Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Spectral \Spec"tral\, a. 1. Of or pertaining to a specter; ghosty. [1913 Webster]
He that feels timid at the spectral form of evil is not the man to spread light. --F. W. Robertson. [1913 Webster]
2. (Opt.) Of or pertaining to the spectrum; made by the spectrum; as, spectral colors; spectral analysis. [1913 Webster]
{Spectral lemur}. (Zo["o]l.) See {Tarsius}. [1913 Webster]

spectral adj 1: of or relating to a spectrum; "spectral colors"; "spectral analysis" 2: like or being a phantom; "a ghostly face at the window"; "a phantasmal presence in the room"; "spectral emanations"; "spiritual tappings at a seance" [syn: {apparitional}, {ghostlike}, {ghostly}, {phantasmal}, {spiritual}]
